blocks.value: St. Teresa of Calcutta (Mother Teresa) was born in 1910 in Skopje (now in North Macedonia). She joined the Sisters of Loreto and became a teacher in Calcutta, India. In 1946, she received what she called a "call within a call" from Jesus, asking her to leave the convent and serve Him among the poorest of the poor in the slums of Calcutta.

In 1950, Mother Teresa founded the Missionaries of Charity, a religious congregation devoted to serving the "poorest of the poor." She and her sisters opened homes for the dying, orphanages, and centers for those with leprosy and HIV/AIDS. Mother Teresa saw Jesus in every suffering person she served.
Mother Teresa died on September 5, 1997, and was canonized by Pope Francis on September 4, 2016. She is the patron saint of World Youth Day.
